resources.string: Do you see 2 different colors (shades)\nin this image?

Test will help you determine how well you can distinguish shades of colors.\n\nThis test is a modified and adapted for mobile devices version of the Diana Derval test. Go to www.dervalresearch.com to find out more.
Weak color perception. You probably prefer black, beige and blue clothes.\nThis category includes about 25\% of people.
Average color perception. You distinguish many shades of purple/blue, green and red.\nThis category includes about 50\% of people.

Good color perception! You distinguish between many shades of purple/blue, green, red, and yellow. Most likely, yellow annoys you and you don’t wear clothes of this color.\nThis category includes about 25\% of people.

This test will help determine if you have myopia or farsightedness.

Attention!
Test is run in turn for both eyes. First, close one eye with your hand and look at the image. Then repeat this for the other eye. Answer the relevant questions at the end of the test.
Close one eye and look at the image. Then close the other eye and repeat the actions.
What did you see in the image?
Characters on the red background were sharper
Characters on the green background were sharper
Characters on both backgrounds were equally sharp
Warning! Eye problems detected. Visit your ophthalmologist for a professional eye check.
This test will help you assess whether you can clearly distinguish areas of the image with low contrast.\nFor best accuracy of the test, it is advisable to keep your smartphone at arm\'s length.

Warning! The accuracy of the test substantially depends on the screen quality of your device. If it has low brightness or color reproduction, then you may not pass the last steps of the test, even with perfect vision.
Click on the arrow in the direction in which the circle has a cutout
Good result!\nThe lower the minimum discernible contrast - the better result.
Perfect result!\nYou cannot distinguish 0\% contrast - then there would be no difference between the image and the background.
This test will help you identify the presence of various types of color perception anomalies.\nThe well-known tables of prof. Rabkin E.B. are used in this test.
Warning! The accuracy of the test substantially depends on the screen quality of your device. If it has low brightness or color reproduction, this may introduce inaccuracy into the test results.
What do you see in the image?

This test is designed to evaluate your visual acuity. Such test usually takes place when visiting an ophthalmologist.

To perform the test correctly, keep your smartphone at arm's length.

You can change the symbol set for the test in the menu at the bottom of the screen.

Warning! Before passing the test, be sure to calibrate the image scale in the application settings and also enter the length of your hand. You can quickly go to the scaling settings from the menu at the bottom of the screen.

Before passing the test, be sure to calibrate the image scale in the application settings, and also enter the length of your hand.

1. Take off glasses/lenses if available.

2. Read on the screen which eye to close, and carefully close it with your free hand. Do not press on the eye.

3. Hold the smartphone at arm's length and press the "Start" button.

4.A symbol will appear on the screen. You need to try to recognize it and remember. When you are ready, click on the "Answer" button.

5. Select the symbol seen on the previous screen and click on the "Continue" button. If you could not consider the character, select the option "I can not answer".

6. Repeat the previous steps until the test completes.

7. You can select the character set as well as the eye to be checked in the previous test description screen.
Softly close your\nleft eye with hand
Softly close your\nright eye with hand
Choose which symbol you have seen
Hold your smartphone at arm\'s length and press the button
Are you sure you want to interrupt the test? Current progress will be lost.
Choose which part of your activity period is now. For most people, this is morning, day, or evening, respectively.

This test will help determine if you have astigmatism.

Attention!
During your test, keep your phone at arm's length.
Test is run in turn for both eyes. First, close one eye with your hand and look at the image. Then repeat this for the other eye. Answer the relevant questions at the end of the test.
The rays begin to merge exactly half their length; distortion border perfectly round
The image merges into a solid gray mass
Rays blur, intersect or become negative; Distortion border is different from round

the set value for the length of your arm. Measure your arm length and then enter it by clicking the button below. Alternatively, you can enter your height, then the arm length will be calculated from it using the formula.
Enter your arm\'s length in centimeters
Enter your body height in centimeters
Measure the red line below using the ruler and enter the result. Current value
Input red line\'s length in centimeters
Are you sure you want to delete this entry from the journal?
ATTENTION! All test results will be deleted from the journal. Are you sure you want to continue?
Journal was exported successfully into a folder
Average acuity is %.2f for left eye and %.2f for right eye.
Your vision changed for %d %s by %+.1f%% for left eye and by %+.1f%% for right eye.
Difference in acuity between eyes is %.2f.
Enter the results of the acuity checkup by the doctor
Enter results for at least one eye
The test result is very similar to erroneous, it is recommended to try passing the test again

This application is an open source project written by one person for free. You can write about all problems and wishes to the email specified in the settings in the \"About app\" section. There you will also find a link to the source code repository.

2.1.0
• Optimization for Android 14.
• Redesign and UI improvements.
• Color perception test improved.
• Bug fixes.

2.0.2
• Bug fixes.

2.0.1
• Default language fixed.

2.0.0
• Optimization for Android 11–13.
• Redesign and UI improvements.
• Bug fixes.
